channel.title: Fortification on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Fortification on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Most people have major problems of milk as a source of vitamin D
item.description:

Original Tiki: ------------- !!Highlights from [http://opinionator.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/07/07/got-milk-you-dont-need-it/ |New York Times blog on Milk July 2012] !!!By Bittman, author of book: Food Matters *US Department of Agriculture, encouraged by the Dairy lobby, had recommended 2 lbs of milk per day ( four 8 ounce glasses) *We do not consume 2 lbs of anything else per day +Even the per-capita consumption of soda is only 1 lb per day *Now they have reduced the recommendation to [http://www.choosemyplate.gov/food-groups/dairy-amount.html| 3 cups] = 1.5 lbs per day *But, 50 million Americans are lactose intolerant +90% of Asian-Americans +75% of African-Americans, Mexican-Americans, and Jews +__~~#090:Note: 100 IU of vitamin D in one 8 ounce glass of milk, so 3 glasses per day = a paltry 300 IU~~__ !!! Highlights from [http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/PMH0001321/|NIH] *Premature babies sometimes have lactose intolerance. *Approximately 30 million American adults have some amount of lactose intolerance by age 20. !!!Highlights from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lactose_intolerance|Wikipedia] *Most mammals normally become lactose intolerant after weaning, but some human populations have developed + __lactase persistence__, in which lactase production continues into adulthood. *It is estimated that __75% of adults worldwide show some decrease in lactase activity during adulthood__ *It has now been shown that lactase persistence is caused by several independently occurring mutations. +__~~#090:Hmm! Having problems with lactose is the norm for all animals, tolerance is the mutation in some humans~~__ ||Dairy product| Serving size |% Lactose Milk, regular |250 ml |4.8% Milk, reduced fat| 250 ml |5.2% Yogurt, plain, regular| 200 g |4.5% Yogurt, plain, low-fat |200 g |6.0% Ice cream |50 g|6.0% Butter |1 tsp (5.9ml) |0.5% Cottage cheese |30 g |0.3% Cheddar cheese |30 g |0.07%||
!!!!Calcium bioavailability highlights from [http://www.livestrong.com/article/454597-how-much-calcium-is-absorbed-at-a-time/|LiveStrong] *< 5 % spinach, rhubarb and Swiss chard is absorbed, due to oxalates *20% almonds, sesame seeds, sweet potatoes and pinto beans *30 % milk, cheese and yogurt __~~#00F:{Note: probably varies with vitamin D fortification and fat content}~~__ *50% Brussels sprouts, kale, mustard greens, broccoli, bok choy, cauliflower !!!!Speculation by VitaminDWiki *Back when milk was fortified with vitamin D perhaps 85% of Americans could drink milk *Now it appears only about 63% of American can drink milk. *Wonder when alternate foods will be fortified with vitamin D - in the US and around the world? !!!!See also VitaminDWiki *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=2496|Vitamin D can fortify a variety of food and drinks – even beer – March 2012] *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=2044|Vitamin D history back to Egyptians and fortification - Aug 2011] *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=730|Suppliers surmounting vitamin D fortification challenges – March 2010] *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=209|A plea for vit D food fortification in India May 2010] *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=2627|Food fortified by 440 IU increased vitamin D levels by 8 ng – meta-analysis April 2012] *[https://www.VitaminDWiki.com/tiki-index.php?page_id=2935|Improved health due to vitamin D fortification in Finland] *((Cheese fortified with vitamin D)) *((Milk – Vitamin D deficiency 2X more likely if lactose intolerant, milk allergy, or low fat milk – 2017)) !!!!((Fortification with Vitamin D)) {include page="Fortification with Vitamin D" start="~tc~ start ~/tc~" stop="~tc~ end ~/tc~"}
!!!!((Fortification with Vitamin D|Bread Fortification)) appears to be far better than milk fortification {include page="Fortification with Vitamin D" start="~tc~ startb ~/tc~" stop="~tc~ endb ~/tc~"} </code> </pre>
